thread.title: Likely U.S. Pacific Commander Has Spent Little Time in Asia

author: Gordon Lubold
title: Likely U.S. Pacific Commander Has Spent Little Time in Asia
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”The White House is poised to nominate an admiral considered a rising star in the Navy but who has scant recent experience in Asia to lead the U.S. Pacific Command and oversee military efforts to respond to the rise of China and the threat posed by North Korea.
Adm. Philip Davidson, now head of U.S. Fleet Forces Command, is expected to get the nod to lead Pacific Command in coming weeks, a number of U.S. officials said. He would succeed Adm. Harry Harris, who will retire and, if confirmed, become the next U.S. ambassador...
